1.text: Wash the potatoes then pierce them with a fork.

2.text: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C) and oil the outside of the potatoes.

3.text: Wrap the potatoes loosely in aluminum foil.

5.text: Leave the potatoes in the oven for 15 minutes after baking them.

6.text: Refrigerate or freeze the leftovers in an airtight container.

8.text: Preheat the oven to 450 °F (232 °C) and place the potatoes on a rimmed baking sheet.

9.text: Toss the potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.

10.text: Roast the potatoes for 35-45 minutes, tossing them occasionally.

11.text: Serve the potatoes and put any leftovers in the fridge for up to 5 days.

13.text: Place the sweet potatoes in a saucepan and cover them with water.

14.text: Heat the potatoes until the water boils, then reduce the heat.

15.text: Cover the pan and simmer the potatoes for 25-35 minutes.

16.text: Drain the potatoes, allow them to cool, then remove the skins.

17.text: Cut the potatoes into 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) slices.

18.text: Put brown sugar, butter, water, and salt in a skillet.

19.text: Heat the mixture, stirring constantly, until it is smooth and bubbling.

20.text: Add the potatoes and cook them for another 2-4 minutes.

21.text: Wash and peel the sweet potatoes.

23.text: Cut the potatoes into 1⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) slices.

25.text: Toss the potatoes in a mix of club soda and cornstarch.

26.text: Fry the sweet potatoes for 2-4 minutes.

27.text: Season the fries with salt, if desired, and serve them.
